title: Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve: Vote now for May’s most clutch delivery
description: May brought countless serves across the ATP Tour, but three stood out for their boldness, precision and high-stakes impact. From Holger Rune’s marathon hold to Carlos Alcaraz’s calm under pressure and Alexandre Muller’s underarm surprise, these moments defined what the Perfect Serve is all about. In this second edition of ATP Perfect Serve, brought to you by Stella Artois, we spotlight three standout serves. Now it’s your turn to decide who delivered May’s best under pressure during the European clay swing. Watch the video below, then head to our Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve hub to vote for your favourite! Visit the Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve hub to vote for your favourite now! In May, three standout serves turned the tide in key matches. Rune, down 1-4 to Francisco Comesana in Rome, fought through a gruelling 23-minute service game, saving six break points and the last with a 121 mph serve followed by a winner. Rome champion Alcaraz also showed nerves of steel in the Italian capital. Trailing 15/40 when serving for the first set against Jack Draper, the Spaniard landed three first serves and reeled off four straight points to take the set, saving eight break points overall. Meanwhile, in Hamburg, Alexandre Muller delivered the month’s most audacious moment, catching Alexander Zverev off guard with a perfectly timed underarm serve that won the point and stunned the crowd. Nothing Major podcast hosts Sam Querrey, Jack Sock and Steve Johnson weighed in with their thoughts on which player did it best. But ultimately, the decision is yours! Stella Artois, one of the world's leading premium beer brands, is a Gold Partner and Official Beer of the ATP Tour through 2028. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Carlos Alcaraz, Holger Rune and Alexandre Muller are featured in the Stella Artois Perfect Serve series for May

html:
Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve: Vote now for May’s most clutch delivery

Alcaraz, Muller, Rune have been nominated

June 12, 2025

ATP Tour/Getty Images

By ATP Staff

May brought countless serves across the ATP Tour, but three stood out for their boldness, precision and high-stakes impact. From Holger Rune’s marathon hold to Carlos Alcaraz’s calm under pressure and Alexandre Muller’s underarm surprise, these moments defined what the Perfect Serve is all about.

In this second edition of ATP Perfect Serve, brought to you by Stella Artois, we spotlight three standout serves. Now it’s your turn to decide who delivered May’s best under pressure during the European clay swing.

Watch the video below, then head to our Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve hub to vote for your favourite!

Visit the Stella Artois ATP Perfect Serve hub to vote for your favourite now!

In May, three standout serves turned the tide in key matches. Rune, down 1-4 to Francisco Comesana in Rome, fought through a gruelling 23-minute service game, saving six break points and the last with a 121 mph serve followed by a winner.

Rome champion Alcaraz also showed nerves of steel in the Italian capital. Trailing 15/40 when serving for the first set against Jack Draper, the Spaniard landed three first serves and reeled off four straight points to take the set, saving eight break points overall.

Meanwhile, in Hamburg, Alexandre Muller delivered the month’s most audacious moment, catching Alexander Zverev off guard with a perfectly timed underarm serve that won the point and stunned the crowd.

Nothing Major podcast hosts Sam Querrey, Jack Sock and Steve Johnson weighed in with their thoughts on which player did it best. But ultimately, the decision is yours!

Stella Artois, one of the world's leading premium beer brands, is a Gold Partner and Official Beer of the ATP Tour through 2028.
